references.title: Clashing Souls
references.desc:
Clashing Souls' TCG text prevents the player's monster from being destroyed by the battle, sending all cards they control to the GY instead.
In the Official Card Game, this is not the case. Here, the monster is determined to be destroyed by the battle as usual, and all cards the monster's controller controls are sent to the GY as a result of this.

references.title: Q&A #20651
references.desc:
This Q&A illustrates the difference between Clashing Souls' TCG and OCG texts.
In the OCG version, Metaltron XII is determined to be destroyed by the battle, causing its Continuous effect to stop applying. As a result, Clashing Souls succeeds in sending it to the GY.
In the TCG version, its Continuous effect is still applying, as it was not determined to be destroyed by the battle. Thus, Clashing Souls would fail to send it to the GY.

references.title: Q&A #9996
references.desc: This Q&A illustrates that Clashing Souls can only succeed in sending Metaltron XII to the GY if its Continuous effect has stopped applying.

name: Clashing Souls

King Dragun's effect only prevents Dragon monsters on the field from being targeted with card effects.
It does not prevent Dragon monsters in either player's GY, or their banished Dragon monsters, from being targeted.

name: King Dragun

oldText:

newText:

oldText:

newText:

Cannot be used as Link Material the turn it is Link Summoned. oldText: During either player's turn: You can send this card from your hand to the Graveyard; this turn, each time your opponent Special Summons a monster(s), immediately draw 1 card. You can only use 1 "Maxx "C"" per turn.
newText: (Quick Effect): You can send this card from your hand to the GY; this turn, each time your opponent Special Summons a monster(s), immediately draw 1 card. You can only use this effect of "Maxx "C"" once per turn.

references.title: Maxx "C"

In the Official Card Game, Maxx "C" has a simple usage restriction on its effect.
The current English print appears to purport a far broader restriction, including actions such as Summoning Maxx "C" or using it as material.

oldText: Fusion Summon 1 Fusion Monster that lists "Buster Blader" as material from your Extra Deck, using monsters from your hand or either field as Fusion Material. references.title: Card FAQ – All-Out Attacks
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, All-Out-Attacks forces all monsters to attack this turn, not just monsters that can successfully be changed to Attack Position.
The current text implies that monsters that are already in Attack Position are not forced to attack.

Herald of the Abyss is an example of such a card.

name: Aussa the Earth Charmer

oldText:

name: Ayers Rock Sunrise
oldText: Target 1 Beast monster in your GY; Special Summon that target, and if you do, all face-up monsters your opponent currently controls lose 200 ATK for each Beast, Plant, and Winged Beast monster currently in your GY, until the end of this turn. You can only activate 1 "Ayers Rock Sunrise" per turn.
newText: Target 1 Beast monster in your GY; Special Summon that target, and if you do, all face-up monsters your opponent currently controls (if any) lose 200 ATK for each Beast, Plant, and Winged Beast monster currently in your GY (if any), until the end of this turn. You can only activate 1 "Ayers Rock Sunrise" per turn.

references.title: Card FAQ – Ayers Rock Sunrise

name: S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru
oldText: Each of your opponent's monsters in the same column as one of your "S-Force" monsters can only target that monster for attacks. (Quick Effect): You can banish 1 "S-Force" card from your hand; return this card to the hand, and if you do, Special Summon 1 "S-Force" monster from your Deck in Defense Position, except "S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru". You can only use this effect of "S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru" once per turn.
newText: Each of your opponent's monsters in the same column as one of your "S-Force" monsters can only target monsters in that column for attacks. (Quick Effect): You can banish 1 "S-Force" card from your hand; return this card to the hand, and if you do, Special Summon 1 "S-Force" monster from your Deck in Defense Position, except "S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru". You can only use this effect of "S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru" once per turn.
author: gallantron

references.title: S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, the effect of S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru still allows the opponent's monster to attack a non-"S-Force" monster, as long as it is in the same column.
An example would be a Knightmare Phoenix in the Extra Monster Zone, with S-Force Rappa Chiyomaru immediately below it.

name: Underworld Goddess of the Closed World
oldText:
4+ Effect Monsters
You can also use 1 monster your opponent controls as material to Link Summon this card. If this card is Link Summoned: You can negate the effects of all face-up monsters your opponent currently controls. This Link Summoned card is unaffected by your opponent's activated effects, unless they target this card. Once per turn, when your opponent activates a card or effect that Special Summons a monster(s) from the GY (Quick Effect): You can negate the activation.
newText: 4+ Effect Monsters / You can also use 1 monster your opponent controls as material to Link Summon this card. If this card is Link Summoned: You can negate the effects of all face-up monsters your opponent currently controls. This Link Summoned card is unaffected by your opponent's activated effects, unless they target this card. Once per turn, when your opponent activates a card or effect that includes Special Summoning a monster(s) from the GY (Quick Effect): You can negate the activation.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Underworld Goddess of the Closed World
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, Underworld Goddess of the Closed World's Quick Effect can be activated in response to any effect that includes Special Summoning from the GY.
Its TCG text omits the crucial word "includes" for what we assume to be text box constraints. We opt to use "effect that includes Special Summoning" over "effect that includes an effect to Special Summon" for the same reasons.

references.title: PSY-Framegear Gamma
references.desc: PSY-Framegear Gamma's effect is an example of an effect that "includes an effect to Special Summon from the GY", while not being an effect that "would Special Summon from the GY".

references.title: Q&A #15901
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Light of Intervention's effect causes effects that Special Summon in face-down Defense Position to Summon the monster face-up, instead.

newText: If you control a "F.A." monster, this card cannot be destroyed by your opponent's card effects. When your "F.A." monster whose Level is at least 5 higher than its original Level battles an opponent's monster and inflicts battle damage to them: You can banish 1 card from your hand, field, or GY. You can only use this effect of "F.A. Winners" once per turn. If 3 of your "F.A." Field Spells with different names are currently banished, and were all banished by the effect of "F.A. Winners", you win the Duel.
author: gallantron

references.title: F.A. Winners
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, F.A. Winners' effect to banish cards is restricted on usage, not activation.

name: Felgrand Dragon
oldText: Cannot be Special Summoned except from the Graveyard, and only if it was sent there from the field. If this card is Special Summoned: Target 1 monster in your Graveyard; this card gains ATK equal to that monster's Level x 200.
newText: Cannot be Special Summoned except from the GY, and only if it was sent there from the field. If this card is Special Summoned from the GY: Target 1 monster in your GY; this card gains ATK equal to that monster's Level x 200.
author: gallantron

references.title: Felgrand Dragon
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, Felgrand Dragon's effect can only be activated if it was Special Summoned from the GY.
The effect cannot be activated if it was Summoned from elsewhere, for example by ignoring its Summoning conditions.

name: Fiend Comedian
oldText: Toss a coin and call it. If you call it right, all your opponent's cards in the Graveyard are removed from play immediately. If you call it wrong, send a number of cards equal to the cards in your opponent's Graveyard from your Deck to your Graveyard.
newText: Toss a coin and call it. If you call it right, banish all cards in your opponent's GY. If you call it wrong, send a number of cards from the top of your Deck to the GY, equal to the number of cards in your opponent's GY.
author: gallantron

references.title: Fiend Comedian
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Fiend Comedian sends cards from the top of the Deck to the GY.

name: Fox Fire
oldText: During the End Phase, if this card was destroyed by battle and sent to the Graveyard this turn and was face-up at the start of the Damage Step: Special Summon this card from the Graveyard. This face-up card cannot be Tributed for a Tribute Summon.
newText: Once per turn, during the End Phase, if this card is in the GY because it was destroyed by battle and sent there this turn: Special Summon this card. This face-up card cannot be Tributed for a Tribute Summon.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Fox Fire
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Fox Fire's effect must be activated even if it was face-down at the start of the Damage Step.

name: Fukubiki
oldText: Each player shuffles their Deck and excavates the top card of their Deck. Add the excavated card with the higher ATK to that player's hand, also send the card with the lower ATK to that player's GY (Spells/Traps, and monsters with ? ATK, are treated as 0). If tied, place those cards on the bottoms of the Decks.
newText: Each player shuffles their Deck and excavates the top card of their Deck. Add the excavated card with the higher ATK to that player's hand, also send the card with the lower ATK to the GY (Spells/Traps, and monsters with ? ATK, are treated as 0). If tied, place the cards on the bottom of the Decks.
author: gallantron

references.title: Fukubiki
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the lower ATK card is not sent to any particular player's GY.

name: Gem-Elephant
oldText: During your Main Phase: You can return this face-up card on the field to the hand. During damage calculation, if this card attacked or was attacked: You can send 1 Normal Monster from your hand to the Graveyard; this card gains 1000 DEF.
newText: During your Main Phase: You can return this face-up card on the field to the hand. During damage calculation, if this card battles: You can send 1 Normal Monster from your hand to the GY; this card gains 1000 DEF during that damage calculation only.
author: gallantron

references.title: Gem-Elephant
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Gem-Elephant's DEF is only increased during the damage calculation that its effect resolved in.

name: Shaddoll Core
oldText: Special Summon this card as an Effect Monster (Spellcaster/DARK/Level 9/ATK 1450/DEF 1950). (This card is also still a Trap.) If Summoned this way, you can substitute this monster for 1 Fusion Material that lists an Attribute, on a "Shaddoll" Fusion Monster Card. If this card is sent to the GY by a card effect: You can target 1 "Shaddoll" Spell/Trap in your GY, except "Shaddoll Core"; add it to your hand.
newText: Special Summon this card as an Effect Monster (Spellcaster/DARK/Level 9/ATK 1450/DEF 1950). (This card is also still a Trap.) If Summoned this way, this card can be used as a substitute for any 1 Fusion Material that lists an Attribute, on a "Shaddoll" Fusion Monster Card. If this card is sent to the GY by a card effect: You can target 1 "Shaddoll" Spell/Trap in your GY, except "Shaddoll Core"; add it to your hand.
author: gallantron

references.title: Shaddoll Core
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Shaddoll Core's effect can be applied by the opponent when performing a Fusion Summon, such as due to the effect of Super Polymerization.

references.title: Q&A #12768
references.desc: King of the Swamp is a comparable card, whose effect can also be applied by the opponent when performing a Fusion Summon.

name: Gladiator Beast Lanista
oldText: When this card is Special Summoned by the effect of a "Gladiator Beast" monster: Target 1 "Gladiator Beast" monster in your Graveyard; banish that target, and this card's name becomes the target's name until the End Phase. At the end of the Battle Phase, if this card attacked or was attacked: You can shuffle it into the Deck; Special Summon 1 "Gladiator Beast" monster from your Deck, except "Gladiator Beast Lanista".
newText: When this card is Special Summoned by the effect of a "Gladiator Beast" monster: You can target 1 "Gladiator Beast" monster in your GY; banish that target, and if you do, this card's name becomes the target's name until the End Phase. At the end of the Battle Phase, if this card battled: You can shuffle it into the Deck; Special Summon 1 "Gladiator Beast" monster from your Deck, except "Gladiator Beast Lanista".
author: gallantron

references.title: Gladiator Beast Lanista
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Gladiator Beast Lanista's effect is optional to activate.

name: Ignition Beast Volcannon
oldText:
1 Machine-Type monster + 1 Pyro-Type monster
When this card is Fusion Summoned: You can target 1 monster your opponent controls; destroy that target, also destroy this card, then if both monsters were destroyed, inflict damage to your opponent equal to the ATK of the monster in the Graveyard that was targeted by this effect.
newText:
1 Machine monster + 1 Pyro monster
When this card is Fusion Summoned: You can target 1 monster your opponent controls; destroy both that target and this card, then inflict damage to your opponent equal to the ATK of the targeted monster in the GY.
author: gallantron

references.title: Q&A #10309
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, if either card no longer exists on the field, the other is not destroyed.

references.title: Q&A #10311
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, if the opponent's monster is not sent to the GY as a result of being destroyed, no damage is inflicted.

name: Interrupt Resistor
oldText: When you take battle damage: You can Special Summon this card from your hand, and if you do, it gains ATK equal to the damage you took. Once per turn, during damage calculation, when another Defense Position monster you control is attacked by an opponent's monster (Quick Effect): You can activate this effect; during this damage calculation, your attacked monster's DEF becomes equal to this card's DEF, also it cannot be destroyed by that battle.
newText: When you take battle damage: You can Special Summon this card from your hand, and if you do, it gains ATK equal to the damage you took. Once per turn, during damage calculation, when another Defense Position monster you control is attacked by an opponent's monster: You can activate this effect; during this damage calculation, your attacked monster's DEF becomes equal to this card's DEF, also it cannot be destroyed by that battle.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Interrupt Resistor
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the second effect of Interrupt Resistor is a Trigger effect.

name: Legendary Six Samurai - Mizuho
oldText: If you control "Legendary Six Samurai - Shinai", you can Special Summon this card (from your hand). Once per turn: You can Tribute another face-up "Six Samurai" monster, then target 1 card on the field; destroy that target.
newText: If you control "Legendary Six Samurai - Shinai", you can Special Summon this card (from your hand). Once per turn: You can Tribute 1 other "Six Samurai" monster, then target 1 card on the field; destroy that target.
author: gallantron

references.title: Legendary Six Samurai - Mizuho
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, you do not need to Tribute a face-up "Six Samurai" monster to activate Legendary Six Samurai - Shinai's effect.

name: Lightforce Sword
oldText: Banish 1 random card from your opponent's hand, face-down. During your opponent's 4th Standby Phase after this card's activation, return that card to their hand.
newText: Banish 1 random card from your opponent's hand, face-down. During the Standby Phase of your opponent's 4th turn after this card's activation, return that card to their hand.
author: gallantron

references.title: Lightforce Sword
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, the banished card is returned during the Standby Phase of the 4th turn, rather than the 4th Standby Phase.
(If Lightforce Sword resolves during the opponent's Draw Phase, the Standby Phase of the 4th turn will be their 5th Standby Phase.)

name: Lunalight Serenade Dance
oldText:
When a Fusion Monster(s) is Fusion Summoned to your field (except during the Damage Step): You can target 1 of those monsters; apply these effects in sequence.
●Special Summon 1 "Lunalight Token" (Beast-Warrior/DARK/Level 4/ATK 2000/DEF 2000) to your opponent's field.
●That target gains 500 ATK for each monster your opponent controls (even if this card leaves the field).
During your Main Phase: You can banish this card from your GY; send 1 card from your hand to the GY, and if you do, Special Summon 1 "Lunalight" monster from your Deck. You can only use this effect of "Lunalight Serenade Dance" once per turn.
newText:
When a Fusion Monster(s) is Fusion Summoned to your field (except during the Damage Step): You can target 1 of those monsters; Special Summon 1 "Lunalight Token" (Beast-Warrior/DARK/Level 4/ATK 2000/DEF 2000) to your opponent's field, also that target gains 500 ATK for each monster your opponent controls (if any) (even if this card leaves the field).
During your Main Phase: You can banish this card from your GY; send 1 card from your hand to the GY, and if you do, Special Summon 1 "Lunalight" monster from your Deck. You can only use this effect of "Lunalight Serenade Dance" once per turn.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Lunalight Serenade Dance
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Special Summoning a Lunalight Token and the Fusion Monster gaining ATK are treated as having happened simultaneously.

references.title: Q&A #22223
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of Lunalight Serenade Dance can be activated even if the opponent does not control any monsters.

references.title: Q&A #22236
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, even if the effect of Lunalight Serenade Dance fails to Special Summon a "Lunalight Token", the targeted monster's ATK is still increased.

references.title: Pulse Mines
references.desc: Pulse Mines is an example of "(if any)" being used to indicate that no appropriate monsters are required to activate the effect.

name: Light of Judgment
oldText:
If "The Sanctuary in the Sky" is on the field: Discard 1 LIGHT monster to the GY; apply 1 of the following effects.
●Look at your opponent's hand and discard 1 card from their hand.
●Send 1 card your opponent controls to the GY.
newText:
If "The Sanctuary in the Sky" is on the field: Discard 1 LIGHT monster to the GY; apply 1 of the following effects.
●Look at your opponent's hand and send 1 card from it to the GY.
●Send 1 card your opponent controls to the GY.
author: gallantron

references.title: Light of Judgment
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the chosen card in the opponent's hand is merely sent to the GY, not discarded.

name: Mana Dragon Zirnitron
oldText: If a Spell/Trap you control leaves the field because of an opponent's effect, and is now in the GY or banished (except during the Damage Step): You can Special Summon this card from your GY (if it was there when that Spell/Trap left) or hand (even if not), then you can Set 1 Spell/Trap that is banished or in your GY to your Spell & Trap Zone. You can only use this effect of "Mana Dragon Zirnitron" once per turn. If Summoned this way, banish this card when it leaves the field.
newText: If a Spell/Trap you control leaves the field because of an opponent's effect, and is now in the GY or banished (except during the Damage Step): You can Special Summon this card from your GY (if it was there when that Spell/Trap left) or hand (even if not), then you can Set 1 of your Spells/Traps, that is banished or in the GY, to your Spell & Trap Zone. You can only use this effect of "Mana Dragon Zirnitron" once per turn. If Summoned this way, banish this card when it leaves the field.
author: gallantron

references.title: Mana Dragon Zirnitron
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Mana Dragon Zirnitron's effect only allows banished cards in the player's possession to be Set to the field.

name: Mausoleum of the Emperor
oldText:
During the Main Phase: The turn player can activate these effect(s).
●Pay 1000 LP; immediately after this effect resolves, Normal Summon 1 monster from your hand that requires 1 Tribute, without Tributing.
●Pay 2000 LP; immediately after this effect resolves, Normal Summon 1 monster from your hand that requires 2 Tributes, without Tributing.
(This is their one Normal Summon/Set for that turn.)
newText:
During the Main Phase: The turn player can activate these effect(s).
●Pay 1000 LP; immediately after this effect resolves, Normal Summon/Set 1 monster from your hand that requires 1 Tribute, without Tributing.
●Pay 2000 LP; immediately after this effect resolves, Normal Summon/Set 1 monster from your hand that requires 2 Tributes, without Tributing.
(This is their one Normal Summon/Set for that turn.)
author: gallantron

references.title: Mausoleum of the Emperor
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, the effects of Mausoleum of the Emperor allow you to Normal Set a card.
In particular, note that the Japanese 通常召喚, which literally translates to "Normal Summon", is the OCG equivalent of the TCG's "Normal Summon or Set".
The OCG equivalent to "Normal Summon (but not Set)" would be just 召喚.

name: Meklord Army Deployer Obbligato
oldText: During your Main Phase: You can activate this effect; destroy this card, and if you do, Special Summon 2 "Meklord Army" monsters from your Deck in Defense Position, except "Meklord Army Deployer Obbligato", also you cannot Special Summon monsters for the rest of this turn, except Machine monsters. If this card is sent to the GY: You can activate this effect; during the End Phase of this turn, you can inflict 100 damage to your opponent for each "Meklord" monster you control. You can only use each effect of "Meklord Army Deployer Obbligato" once per turn.
newText: During your Main Phase: You can activate this effect; destroy this card, and if you do, Special Summon 2 "Meklord Army" monsters from your Deck in Defense Position, except "Meklord Army Deployer Obbligato", also you cannot Special Summon monsters for the rest of this turn, except Machine monsters. If this card is sent to the GY: You can activate this effect; during the End Phase of this turn, inflict 100 damage to your opponent for each "Meklord" monster you control. You can only use each effect of "Meklord Army Deployer Obbligato" once per turn.
author: gallantron

references.title: Meklord Army Deployer Obbligato
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, while activating the effect of Meklord Army Deployer Obbligato after it is sent to the GY is optional, later applying the effect and inflicting damage during the End Phase is mandatory.

name: Springans Call!
oldText: Target 1 "Springans" monster or "Fallen of Albaz" in your GY; Special Summon it. During the Main Phase, except the turn this card was sent to the GY: You can banish this card and 1 Fusion Monster from your GY, then target 1 "Springans" Xyz Monster you control; attach 1 Fusion Monster that lists "Fallen of Albaz" as material from your Extra Deck to that monster as material. You can only use each effect of "Springans Call!" once per turn.
newText: Target 1 "Springans" monster or "Fallen of Albaz" in your GY; Special Summon it. During either player's turn, except the turn this card was sent to the GY: You can banish this card and 1 Fusion Monster from your GY, then target 1 "Springans" Xyz Monster you control; attach 1 Fusion Monster that lists "Fallen of Albaz" as material from your Extra Deck to that monster as material. You can only use each effect of "Springans Call!" once per turn.
author: gallantron

references.title: Springans Call!
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of Springans Call! in the GY can be activated at any point, not only during the Main Phase.

name: Summon Limit
oldText: Neither player can Summon more than two times per turn. (Negated Summons count toward this limit. Negated cards/effects that would Summon do not count.)
newText: Neither player can Summon more than two times per turn.
author: gallantron

references.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! Official Card Game | Changes due to rule revisions
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, as of April 1st, 2020, negated Summons are no longer counted for Summon Limit.

name: Superancient Deepsea King Coelacanth
oldText: Once per turn: You can discard 1 card; Special Summon as many Level 4 or lower Fish-Type monsters as possible from your Deck, but they cannot declare an attack and their effects are negated. During either player's turn, when this face-up card on the field is targeted by a card effect: You can Tribute 1 other Fish-Type monster; negate the activation, and if you do, destroy that card.
newText: Once per turn: You can discard 1 card; Special Summon as many Level 4 or lower Fish monsters as possible from your Deck, but they cannot declare an attack and their effects are negated. When this face-up card on the field is targeted by a card effect (Quick Effect): You can Tribute 1 other Fish monster; negate that effect, and if you do, destroy that card.
author: gallantron

references.title: Superancient Deepsea King Coelacanth
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of Superancient Deepsea King Coelacanth only negates the effect of the preceding Chain Link, not its activation.

name: Tempest Magician
oldText:
1 Tuner + 1 or more non-Tuner Spellcaster-Type monsters
When this card is Synchro Summoned, place 1 Spell Counter on it. Once per turn, you can discard any number of cards to place 1 Spell Counter on a monster(s) you control for each card you discarded. You can remove all Spell Counters on the field to inflict 500 damage to your opponent for each removed Spell Counter.
newText:
1 Tuner + 1+ non-Tuner Spellcaster monsters
If this card is Synchro Summoned: place 1 Spell Counter on it. Once per turn: You can send any number of cards from your hand to the GY; place the same number of Spell Counters among monster(s) you control that you can place a Spell Counter on. You can remove all Spell Counters on the field; inflict 500 damage to your opponent for each Spell Counter you removed.
author: gallantron

references.title: Tempest Magician
references.desc: In the Official Card Games, Tempest Magician's effect is activated by sending cards to the GY, rather than by discarding them.

name: Whitefish Salvage
oldText: You can target 1 Fish monster in your GY; add it to your hand. You can only use this effect of "Whitefish Salvage" once per turn. If this card in your possession is destroyed by an opponent's card effect and sent to your GY: Take 1 Fish monster from your Deck, and either add it to your hand or Special Summon it.
newText: You can target 1 Fish monster in your GY; add it to your hand. You can only use this effect of "Whitefish Salvage" once per turn. If this card in your possession is destroyed by an opponent's card effect and sent to your GY: You can take 1 Fish monster from your Deck, and either add it to your hand or Special Summon it.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Whitefish Salvage
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, activating the effect of Whitefish Salvage when it is sent to the GY is optional.

name: Yubel
oldText: This card cannot be destroyed by battle. You take no Battle Damage from battles involving this card. Before damage calculation, when this face-up Attack Position card is attacked by an opponent's monster: Inflict damage to your opponent equal to that monster's ATK. During your End Phase: Tribute 1 other monster or destroy this card. When this card is destroyed, except by its own effect: Its owner can Special Summon 1 "Yubel - Terror Incarnate" from their hand, Deck, or Graveyard.
newText: This card cannot be destroyed by battle. You take no Battle Damage from battles involving this card. If this card was attacked by an opponent's monster while it was in face-up Attack Position, before damage calculation: Inflict damage to your opponent equal to that monster's ATK. During your End Phase: Tribute 1 other monster or destroy this card. When this card is destroyed, except by its own effect: Its owner can Special Summon 1 "Yubel - Terror Incarnate" from their hand, Deck, or GY.
author: gallantron

references.title: Yubel
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, in order to activate its effect, Yubel needs to have been in face-up Attack Position when chosen as the attack target. It does not need to be in face-up Attack Position upon reaching Before Damage Calculation.

name: Zefra Metaltron
oldText:
2+ monsters Special Summoned from the Extra Deck
If a monster(s) this card points to that was Special Summoned from the Extra Deck is destroyed by battle or an opponent's card effect: Add 1 monster from your GY or 1 face-up Pendulum Monster from your Extra Deck to your hand. You can target 1 monster on each player's field that was Special Summoned from the Extra Deck, except this card; banish both until the End Phase. You can only use each effect of "Zefra Metaltron" once per turn.
newText:
2+ monsters Special Summoned from the Extra Deck
If a monster(s) this card points to that was Special Summoned from the Extra Deck is destroyed by battle or an opponent's card effect: You can add 1 monster from your GY, or 1 face-up Pendulum Monster from your Extra Deck, to your hand. You can target 1 monster on each player's field that was Special Summoned from the Extra Deck, except this card; banish both until the End Phase. You can only use each effect of "Zefra Metaltron" once per turn.
author: gallantron

references.title: Zefra Metaltron
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of Zefra Metaltron that adds a monster from the GY or the Extra Deck to the hand is optional to activate.

name: Number 9: Dyson Sphere
oldText:
2 Level 9 monsters
During your Main Phase 1, if your opponent controls a monster with higher ATK than this card: You can detach 1 material from this card; this card can attack directly this turn. Once per Battle Step, if this card with material is attacked (Quick Effect): You can negate that attack. When this card is targeted for an attack while it has no material: You can target 2 monsters in your GY; attach those monsters to this card as material.
newText:
2 Level 9 monsters
During your Main Phase 1, if your opponent controls a monster with higher ATK than this card: You can detach 1 material from this card; this card can attack directly this turn. Once per battle, during the Battle Step, if this card with material is being attacked (Quick Effect): You can negate that attack. When this card is targeted for an attack while it has no material: You can target 2 monsters in your GY; attach those monsters to this card as material.
author: gallantron

references.title: Q&A #12452
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of Number 9: Dyson Sphere can be activated each time an opponent's monster attacks Number 9: Dyson Sphere. This is true even if the preceding attack was negated, and the Battle Step thus never ended.

name: Downbeat
oldText: Tribute 1 face-up monster; Special Summon from your Deck, 1 monster with the same original Type and Attribute that the Tributed monster had on the field, but 1 Level lower. You can only activate 1 "Downbeat" per turn.
newText: Tribute 1 face-up monster; Special Summon from your Deck, 1 monster with the same original Type and Attribute that the Tributed monster had on the field, but 1 Level lower than its original Level on the field. You can only activate 1 "Downbeat" per turn.
author: gallantron

references.title: Downbeat
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Downbeat's text specifies that it uses the monster's original Level while on the field.

name: Boss Rush
oldText: You cannot Normal Summon or Set. During the End Phase of the turn that a "B.E.S." monster or a "Big Core" is destroyed and sent to the Graveyard, you can Special Summon 1 "B.E.S." monster or 1 "Big Core" from your Deck.
newText: You cannot activate this card if you Normal Summoned/Set this turn. While this card is face-up on the field, you cannot Normal Summon/Set. During the End Phase, if a face-up "B.E.S." monster, or a face-up "Big Core", was destroyed and sent to the GY this turn: You can Special Summon 1 "B.E.S." monster or 1 "Big Core" from your Deck.
author: gallantron

references.title: Boss Rush
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, you cannot activate Boss Rush after you have Normal Summoned/Set that turn.

references.title: Pendulum Call
references.desc: "Pendulum Call" is another card using the "You cannot activate this card if..." construct.

name: Puppet King
oldText: When your opponent adds a Monster Card(s) to their hand, except by drawing, you can Special Summon this card from your hand. If you do, destroy it during your next turn's End Phase.
newText: When your opponent adds a Monster Card(s) from the Deck to their hand, except by drawing: You can Special Summon this card from your hand. If you do, during the End Phase of your next turn: destroy this card.
author: gallantron

references.title: Puppet King
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of Puppet King that Special Summons it can only be activated if a card is added from the Deck to the opponent's hand, rather than from anywhere.

name: Union Attack
oldText: Target 1 face-up monster you control; add up the total ATK of all other face-up Attack Position monsters you currently control, then during the Battle Phase of this turn only, the monster gains that much ATK, but cannot inflict Battle Damage to your opponent, also other face-up Attack Position monsters cannot attack.
newText: Target 1 face-up monster you control; this turn, that monster cannot inflict Battle Damage to your opponent, also other face-up Attack Position monsters cannot attack, also, during the Start Step of each Battle Phase this turn, have that monster gain ATK equal to the total ATK of all other Attack Position monsters you control, until the end of that Battle Phase.
author: gallantron

references.title: Union Attack
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Union Attack sums up the ATK of the other face-up Attack Position monsters during each Start Step, rather than at the time that Union Attack resolves.

name: Ancient Warriors Saga - East-by-South Winds
oldText:
You must send this card to the GY during your 2nd Standby Phase after activation. Once per turn, during your Main Phase: Toss a coin and if the result is heads, send this card to the GY. If this card is sent from the Spell & Trap Zone to the GY: You can activate this effect; this turn, your opponent cannot activate cards or effects in response to the activation of your "Ancient Warriors" cards and effects, also until the end of the turn, all "Ancient Warriors" Effect Monsters you currently control gain this effect.
●When this card declares an attack: You can destroy 1 card your opponent controls.
newText:
You must send this card to the GY during your 2nd Standby Phase after activation. Once per turn, during your Main Phase, you can: Toss a coin and if the result is heads, send this card to the GY. If this card is sent from the Spell & Trap Zone to the GY: You can activate this effect; this turn, your opponent cannot activate cards or effects in response to the activation of your "Ancient Warriors" cards and effects, also until the end of the turn, all "Ancient Warriors" Effect Monsters you currently control gain this effect.
●When this card declares an attack: You can destroy 1 card your opponent controls.
author: gallantron

references.title: Ancient Warriors Saga - East-by-South Winds
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of Ancient Warriors Saga - East-by-South Winds that potentially sends it to the GY is optional to activate.

name: Numeron Network
oldText: During your Main Phase, send 1 "Numeron" Normal Spell Card that meets its activation conditions from your Deck to the GY; this effect becomes that Spell's effect when that card is activated. You can only use this effect of "Numeron Network" once per turn. "Numeron" Xyz Monsters you control can activate effects without detaching material(s).
newText: During your Main Phase, you can: send 1 "Numeron" Normal Spell Card that meets its activation conditions from your Deck to the GY; this effect becomes that Spell's effect when that card is activated. oldText: While you control an "Amorphage" monster, neither player can add cards from their Deck to their hand except by drawing them. Once per turn, during your Standby Phase, Tribute 1 monster or destroy this card.

name: Number 6: Chronomaly Atlandis
oldText:
2 Level 6 monsters
When this card is Xyz Summoned: You can target 1 "Number" monster in your Graveyard; equip that target to this card. This card gains ATK equal to half the ATK of that equipped monster. Once per turn: You can detach 1 Xyz Material from this card, then send the monster equipped by this effect to the Graveyard; halve your opponent's Life Points. You cannot conduct your Battle Phase the turn you activate this effect.

2 Level 6 monsters

In the Official Card Game, the equipped card must be sent to the GY from your Spell & Trap Zone.
For example, if the opponent takes control of Number 6 using Mind Control, they cannot activate that effect, as the equipped card is not in their Spell & Trap Zone.

name: Morph King Stygi-Gel
oldText: If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can target 1 other face-up monster on the field; you cannot Special Summon monsters from the Extra Deck, except Synchro Monsters, for the rest of this turn, also change this card's Level to the Level of that target, and if you do, gain LP equal to that target's Level x 200. During your Main Phase: You can Special Summon 1 Fiend monster with a Level lower than this card from your hand. You can only use this effect of "Morph King Stygi-Gel" once per turn.
newText: If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can target 1 other face-up monster on the field; you cannot Special Summon monsters from the Extra Deck, except Synchro Monsters, for the rest of this turn, also change this card's Level to the Level of that target, and if you do, gain LP equal to that target's Level x 200. name: Machina Citadel

(Quick Effect): You can target 1 Machine monster you control; destroy that Machine monster and all monsters your opponent controls with ATK less than or equal to it. If a face-up EARTH Machine monster(s) you control, except "Machina Citadel", is destroyed by battle or card effect while this card is in your GY: You can Special Summon this card. You can only use each effect of "Machina Citadel" once per turn.

name: Reversible Beetle
oldText:
FLIP: Shuffle this card, and any face-up monsters in its column, into the Deck(s).

newText:
FLIP: Shuffle this card, also any face-up monsters in its column, into the Deck(s).

newText: When a Spell/Trap Card, or monster effect, is activated that targets exactly 1 monster you control, and would destroy that monster: negate the activation, and if you do, destroy that card, then inflict 500 damage to your opponent.

references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Guard Mines negates the activation of the Chain Link it was chained to, rather than its effect.

name: Bound Wand

name: Anti-Spell Fragrance
oldText: Both players must Set Spell Cards before activating them, and cannot activate them until their next turn after Setting them.

references.desc: In the Official Card Game, tributing the targeted monster and Special Summoning a Spellcaster monster are treated as having happened simultaneously.

name: The Door of Destiny
oldText: When an opponent's monster declares a direct attack: Negate the attack, then Special Summon this card as an Effect Monster (Fiend-Type/LIGHT/Level 1/ATK 0/DEF 0). (This card is also still a Trap Card.) During your Standby Phase, while this card is treated as a monster: You can banish any number of "Utopia" monsters with different names from your Graveyard; inflict 500 damage to your opponent for each of those banished monsters, and if you do, this card gains ATK equal to the damage they took.
newText: You can activate this card when an opponent's monster declares a direct attack. When this card's activation resolves, negate the attack, then Special Summon this card as an Effect Monster (Fiend/LIGHT/Level 1/ATK 0/DEF 0). (This card is also still a Trap Card.) During your Standby Phase, while this card is treated as a monster: You can banish any number of "Utopia" monsters with different names from your GY; inflict 500 damage to your opponent for each of those banished monsters, and if you do, this card gains ATK equal to the damage they took.

references.title: Card FAQ – The Door of Destiny
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, The Door of Destiny's effect that Special Summons itself is the effect of its Trap Card activation.
If The Door of Destiny remains face-up in the Spell & Trap Zone for some reason, in the Official Card Game, that effect cannot later be activated again, even if another opponent's monster declares a direct attack.

name: Ultra Polymerization
oldText: Pay 2000 LP; Fusion Summon 1 Fusion Monster from your Extra Deck, using 2 monsters you control as Fusion Materials. Neither player can activate cards or effects in response to this card's activation. You can banish this card from your GY, then target 1 Fusion Monster that was Fusion Summoned with this card's effect; Special Summon all the Fusion Materials used for its Fusion Summon from your GY, but change their ATK/DEF to 0, also they have their effects negated.
newText: Pay 2000 LP; Fusion Summon 1 Fusion Monster from your Extra Deck, using 2 monsters you control as Fusion Materials. Neither player can activate cards or effects in response to this card's activation. You can banish this card from your GY, then target 1 Fusion Monster that was Fusion Summoned with this card's effect; Special Summon all its listed Fusion Materials used for its Fusion Summon from your GY, but change their ATK/DEF to 0, also they have their effects negated.

references.desc: In the Official Card Game, if "Proto-Cyber Dragon" is used as Fusion Material using Ultra Polymerization, the effect of Ultra Polymerization cannot be activated, as "Proto-Cyber Dragon" is not "Cyber Dragon" while in the GY.

references.desc: In the Official Card Game, if Starving Venom Fusion Dragon is Fusion Summoned using Ultra Polymerization, the effect of Ultra Polymerization cannot be activated, as its materials in the GY are not two DARK monsters on your field.

name: Brain Research Lab
oldText: Once per turn, you can Normal Summon 1 Psychic-Type monster in addition to your Normal Summon or Set. If successful, place 1 Psychic Counter on this card. You can also place 1 Psychic Counter on this card instead of paying Life Points to activate any Psychic-Type monster's effect that you control. When this card is removed from the field, the controller of this card takes 1000 damage for each Psychic Counter on it.
newText: If you would pay an amount of LP not greater than your current LP to activate a Psychic monster's effect on your field, you can place 1 Psychic Counter on this card instead of paying LP. During their Main Phase, the turn player can Normal Summon 1 Psychic monster in addition to their Normal Summon/Set. (They can only gain this effect once per turn.) If a Psychic monster is Summoned this way, place 1 Psychic Counter on this card. When this card leaves the field, its controller takes 1000 damage for each Psychic Counter on it.
author: gallantron

references.title: Q&A #8657
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, the effect of Brain Research Lab that allows an additional Normal Summon to be performed can be applied by either player.
However, the effect of Brain Research Lab that allows a Psychic Counter to be placed instead of paying LP can only be applied by its controller.

references.title: Card FAQ – Brain Research Lab
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of Brain Research Lab cannot be applied if the amount of LP paid would exceed the player's current LP.

name: Vylon Disigma
oldText:
3 Level 4 monsters

newText:
3 Level 4 monsters

name: Mecha Phantom Beast Coltwing

You must control another "Mecha Phantom Beast" monster to activate and to resolve this effect. This card's Level is increased by the total Levels of all "Mecha Phantom Beast Tokens" you control. While you control a Token, this card cannot be destroyed by battle or card effects. Once per turn: You can Tribute 2 Tokens, then target 1 card your opponent controls; destroy that target, and if you do, banish it.
newText: If this card is Special Summoned, and you control another "Mecha Phantom Beast" monster: Special Summon 2 "Mecha Phantom Beast Tokens" (Machine/WIND/Level 3/ATK 0/DEF 0). name: Evilswarm Obliviwisp

references.title: Card FAQ – Evilswarm Obliviwisp

name: Fenrir the Nordic Wolf
oldText: Cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. During your Main Phase 2, if an "Aesir" monster is on the field, you can Special Summon this card (from your hand) to your opponent's side of the field in Defense Position. If an "Aesir" monster is not on the field, destroy this card. At the start of your Battle Phase: Change all Defense Position monsters you control to face-up Attack Position. Both players take any battle damage from attacks involving this card.
newText: Cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. Must first be Special Summoned (from your hand) to your opponent's field in Defense Position during your Main Phase 2, while an "Aesir" monster is on the field. If no "Aesir" monster is on the field, destroy this card. At the start of your Battle Phase: Change all Defense Position monsters you control to face-up Attack Position. Both players take any battle damage from attacks involving this card.

references.title: Card FAQ – Fenrir the Nordic Wolf
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Fenrir the Nordic Wolf must first be Special Summoned using the listed procedure, before it can then be improperly Special Summoned using other means.

name: Jormungardr the Nordic Serpent

newText: Cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. Must first be Special Summoned (from your hand) to your opponent's field in Defense Position, while an "Aesir" monster is on the field. name: Pharaoh's Treasure
oldText: Shuffle this card face-up into your Deck. If you draw this face-up card that was added to the Deck by this effect: Send it to the GY, then target 1 card in your GY, except this card; add that target to your hand.
newText: Shuffle this card face-up into your Deck. If you draw this face-up card that was added to the Deck by this effect: Target 1 card in your GY; send this card to the GY, and if you do, add that target to your hand.

references.title: Card FAQ – Pharaoh's Treasure

name: Rank-Up-Magic Numeron Force
oldText: Target 1 face-up Xyz Monster you control; Special Summon from your Extra Deck, 1 "Number C" monster with the same Type as that monster you control, but 1 Rank higher, by using it as the Xyz Material. (This Special Summon is treated as an Xyz Summon. Xyz Materials attached to it also become Xyz Materials on the Summoned monster.) Then, if any face-up cards are on the field other than this card and the monster Summoned by it, negate the effects of those other cards.
newText: Target 1 face-up Xyz Monster you control; Special Summon from your Extra Deck, 1 "Number C" monster with the same Type as that monster you control, but 1 Rank higher, by using it as the entire material. (This Special Summon is treated as an Xyz Summon. Transfer its materials to the Summoned monster.) Then, negate the effects of all face-up cards on the field other than the Summoned monster (if any).

references.title: Q&A #12352
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, if the effect of Rank-Up-Magic Numeron Force is applied by the effect of Numeron Network, the effects of Numeron Network are then also negated.

name: Speed Warrior
oldText: Once per Battle Phase, if this card was Normal Summoned this turn (except during the Damage Step): You can make its ATK become double its original ATK, until the end of the Battle Phase.
newText: Once per Battle Phase, during the Battle Step, if this card was Normal Summoned this turn: You can make its ATK become double its original ATK, until the end of the Battle Phase.

references.title: Card FAQ – Speed Warrior
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of Speed Warrior cannot be activated during the Start Step or the End Step. It can only be activated during the Battle Step.

name: The Phantom Knights of Dark Gauntlets
oldText: Send 1 "Phantom Knights" Spell/Trap from your Deck to the GY. (This card is NOT treated as a Trap.) If Summoned this way, this card gains 300 DEF for each "Phantom Knights" Spell/Trap in your GY.
newText: Send 1 "Phantom Knights" Spell/Trap from your Deck to the GY. When an opponent's monster declares a direct attack while you control no cards and this card is in your GY: You can Special Summon this card in Defense Position as an Effect Monster (Warrior/DARK/Level 4/ATK 300/DEF 600), but banish it when it leaves the field. newText:

name: Number 3: Cicada King
oldText:
2 Level 3 monsters
If the battle position of this card is changed: You can Special Summon 1 Insect monster from your hand or GY in Defense Position. When a monster on the field activates its effect: You can detach 1 material from this card, then target that monster; negate its effects, then make 1 Insect monster on the field either gain 500 DEF, or change its battle position. You can only use each effect of "Number 3: Cicada King" once per turn.
newText:
2 Level 3 monsters
If the battle position of this card is changed: You can Special Summon 1 Insect monster from your hand or GY in Defense Position. When a monster on the field activates its effect (Quick Effect): You can detach 1 material from this card, then target that monster; negate its effects, then make 1 Insect monster on the field either gain 500 DEF, or change its battle position. You can only use each effect of "Number 3: Cicada King" once per turn.
author: gallantron

references.title: Number 3: Cicada King
references.desc:
Number 3: Cicada King's current English text is not explicit about its effect being a Quick Effect.
This is implicit from it responding to another card/effect's activation, but can still easily lead to confusion.

name: Vivid Knight
oldText: During either player's turn (except during the Damage Step), when your opponent targets exactly 1 LIGHT Beast-Warrior-Type monster you control (and no other cards) for an attack, or with a card effect: Banish that monster you control until your next Standby Phase, and if you do, Special Summon this card from your hand.
newText: When your opponent targets exactly 1 LIGHT Beast-Warrior monster you control (and no other cards) for an attack, or with a card effect (except during the Damage Step), you can (Quick Effect): Banish that monster you control until your next Standby Phase, and if you do, Special Summon this card from your hand.

references.title: Card FAQ – Vivid Knight

newText: You can reveal this card in your hand; send the top card of your Deck to the GY, also, after that, if it was a monster in the Deck, inflict damage to your opponent equal to that monster's original Level x 200, also Special Summon this card. Otherwise, destroy this card.

references.title: Q&A #8155

references.title: Q&A #9320
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, even if the opponent takes no damage, Gallis the Star Beast is still Special Summoned.

name: The Regulation of Tribe

references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Regulation of Tribe prevents monsters with the declared type from declaring attacks. (It does not prevent an already-declared attack from proceeding.)

name: Spiritual Forest

references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of Spiritual Forest only prevents the first monster from being destroyed by battle. It does not prevent each monster from being destroyed by battle once.

name: Gladiator Beast Alexander

newText: Cannot be Special Summoned by a card effect, except the effect of "Gladiator Beast Dimacari". This Special Summoned card is unaffected by Spell effects. references.title: Q&A #9075

newText: Cannot be Special Summoned by a card effect, except the effect of "Gladiator Beast Hoplomus". 2 Level 4 "Madolche" monsters

references.desc: In the Official Card Game, if the effect of Madolche Chateau causes the targeted "Madolche" card(s) to be returned to the hand instead of the Deck, these cards are still included in the number of cards returned.

name: Hero Barrier
oldText: Negate 1 attack from an opponent's monster. You must control a face-up "Elemental HERO" monster to resolve this effect.
newText: During your opponent's turn: negate the next attack this turn from a monster your opponent controls while you control an "Elemental HERO" monster.

references.title: Hero Barrier

name: Gravedigger's Trap Hole
oldText: When your opponent activates a monster effect in their hand or GY, or when your opponent's banished monster effect is activated: Negate its effect, and if you do, inflict 2000 damage to your opponent.
newText:
(This card is not treated as a "Trap Hole" card, but is still treated as a "Hole" card.)
When your opponent activates a monster effect in their hand or GY, or when your opponent's banished monster effect is activated: Negate its effect, and if you do, inflict 2000 damage to your opponent.
author: gallantron

references.title: Gravedigger's Trap Hole
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Gravedigger's Trap Hole is not part of the 「落とし穴」 ("Trap Hole") archetype. However, it is a member of the 「ホール」 ("Hole") archetype.

references.title: Traptrix Sera
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Gravedigger's Trap Hole can be Set from the Deck using the effect of Traptrix Sera, which Sets a "Hole" Normal Trap.

references.title: Goblin Pothole Squad
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, the effect of Goblin Pothole Squad, which prevents "Trap Hole"s from being activated when a monster is Summoned, will still allow Gravedigger's Trap Hole to be activated.
This can happen if, for instance, Virtual World Hime - Nyannyan activates its effect in the GY in response to a monster's Normal Summon.

name: Gemini Summoner
oldText: Once per turn, during your opponent's End Phase: You can pay 500 LP; Normal Summon/Set 1 Gemini monster from your hand or Normal Summon 1 face-up Gemini monster you control. The first time this card would be destroyed by battle each turn, it is not destroyed.
newText: Once per turn, during your opponent's End Phase: You can pay 500 LP; immediately after this effect resolves, Normal Summon/Set 1 Gemini monster from your hand or Normal Summon 1 face-up Gemini monster you control. The first time this card would be destroyed by battle each turn, it is not destroyed.

references.title: Card FAQ – Gemini Summoner
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the Normal Summon due to the effect of Gemini Summoner is performed immediately after its effect resolves.

references.title: Solemn Judgment
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, this Normal Summon can be negated by cards such as Solemn Judgment.

name: Spirit's Invitation

references.title: Spirit's Invitation
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the opponent of the player that controls Spirit's Invitation chooses the monster to be returned to the hand.

name: Soul Crossing
oldText:
During the Main Phase: Immediately after this effect resolves, Tribute Summon 1 Divine-Beast monster. When you do, you can Tribute a monster(s) your opponent controls, even though you do not control them, but if you Tribute Summon this way, apply this effect.

●Until the end of the next turn, you can only activate 1 card or effect per turn, not counting the effects of Divine-Beast monsters.
You can only activate 1 "Soul Crossing" per turn.

references.title: Soul Crossing

name: Xtra HERO Infernal Devicer
oldText:
2 "HERO" monsters

references.title: Xtra HERO Infernal Devicer

references.title: MYFI-EN009 Primathmech Laplacian

name: Barrel Behind the Door

references.title: Card FAQ – Barrel Behind the Door
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, Barrel Behind the Door can only be activated in response to a Spell/Trap Card or monster effect activation.

name: Evilswarm Kerykeion
oldText:
You can only use each effect of "Evilswarm Kerykeion" once per turn. While this card is in the Graveyard, if it was sent there this turn, you can Normal Summon 1 "lswarm" monster for 1 less Tribute.
You can banish 1 "lswarm" monster from your Graveyard, then target 1 "lswarm" monster in your Graveyard; add that target to your hand, also, this card gains the following effect.

name: Ido the Supreme Magical Force

references.title: Ido the Supreme Magical Force
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, the Continuous Effect of Ido the Supreme Magical Force also prevents its controller from Normal Setting monsters, not just Summoning them.
In particular, note that the Japanese 通常召喚, which literally translates to "Normal Summon", is the OCG equivalent of the TCG's "Normal Summon or Set".
The OCG equivalent to "Normal Summon (but not Set)" would be just 召喚.

name: The Grand Spellbook Tower
oldText: Once per turn, during your Standby Phase, if you have a Spellcaster-Type monster on your side of the field or in your Graveyard: You can place 1 "Spellbook" Spell Card from your Graveyard on the bottom of your Deck, except "The Grand Spellbook Tower", then draw 1 card. When this card in your possession is destroyed by your opponent's card and sent to your Graveyard: You can Special Summon 1 Spellcaster-Type monster from your hand or Deck whose Level is less than or equal to the number of "Spellbook" Spell Cards in your Graveyard.
newText: Once per turn, during your Standby Phase, if you have a Spellcaster monster on your side of the field or in your GY: You can place 1 "Spellbook" Spell Card from your GY on the bottom of your Deck, except "The Grand Spellbook Tower", then draw 1 card. When this card in your possession is destroyed by your opponent and sent to your GY: You can Special Summon 1 Spellcaster monster from your hand or Deck whose Level is less than or equal to the number of "Spellbook" Spell Cards in your GY.
author: gallantron

name: Borreload Riot Dragon
oldText: You can Ritual Summon this card with "Heavy Interlock". newText: You can Ritual Summon this card with "Heavy Interlock". When your opponent would Special Summon a monster(s) (Quick Effect): You can negate the Special Summon, and if you do, destroy that monster(s), then destroy this card or 1 "Rokket" monster you control. If this card is in your GY: You can target 1 "Borrel" or "Rokket" monster in your GY; destroy 1 card you control or in your hand, and if you do, add that target to your hand. You can only use each effect of "Borreload Riot Dragon" once per turn.

references.title: Black Horn of Heaven

Black Horn of Heaven is an example of a card that activates during an attempted Summon.
In order for its effect to make sense, this is the phrasing Borreload Riot Dragon would need to use.

references.title: Torrential Tribute
references.desc:
Torrential Tribute is an example of a card which activates in response to a successful Summon.
Note that Borreload Riot Dragon currently uses the same phrasing as Torrential Tribute.

name: Ad Libitum of Despia
oldText: During your Main Phase: You can make all monsters currently on the field gain ATK equal to their own Level x 100, until the end of the opponent's turn. If this card in your hand or field is used as Fusion Material, and sent to the GY or banished: You can target 1 of your "Despia" monsters or Level 8 or higher Fusion Monsters, that is banished or in your GY, except "Ad Libitum of Despia"; Special Summon it. You can only use each effect of "Ad Libitum of Despia" once per turn.
newText: During your Main Phase: You can make all monsters currently on the field gain ATK equal to their own Level x 100, until the end of the opponent's turn. If this card in the hand or field is used as material for a Fusion Summon, and sent to the GY or banished: You can target 1 of your "Despia" monsters or Level 8 or higher Fusion Monsters, that is banished or in your GY, except "Ad Libitum of Despia"; Special Summon it. You can only use each effect of "Ad Libitum of Despia" once per turn.

references.title: Card FAQ – Ad Libitum of Despia
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, the effect of Ad Libitum of Despia can only be activated if it is used as material for a Fusion Summon.
Furthermore, in the Official Card Game, the effect of Ad Libitum of Despia can also be activated if it is used as material while the opponent controls it.

references.title: Trishula, the Dragon of Icy Imprisonment
references.desc: For example, in the Official Card Game, the effect of Ad Libitum of Despia cannot be activated if it is used as Fusion Material for the Special Summon of Trishula, the Dragon of Icy Imprisonment.

name: Dice Jar
oldText: FLIP: Both players roll a six-sided die. The player with the lower result takes damage equal to their opponent's roll x 500. However, if the winner rolled a 6, the loser takes 6000 damage. If the rolls are the same, both players roll again.
newText: FLIP: Both players roll a six-sided die. If the player with the higher roll rolled a 2, 3, 4, or 5, inflict damage equal to the roll x 500 to their opponent. If the player with the higher roll rolled a 6, inflict 6000 damage to their opponent. If the rolls are the same, both players roll again.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Dice Jar
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Dice Jar's effect will only inflict damage if the winner's roll is between 2 and 6, inclusive.

references.title: Number 67: Pair-a-Dice Smasher
references.desc: The effect of Number 67: Pair-a-Dice Smasher is one way that the winner's roll might not be in that range.

name: "A" Cell Incubator
oldText: Each time an A-Counter(s) is removed from play by a card effect, place 1 A-Counter on this card. When this card is destroyed, distribute the A-Counters on this card among face-up monsters.
newText: Each time an A-Counter(s) is removed from a card on the field, place 1 A-Counter on this card. If this card is destroyed: Distribute A-Counters among face-up monsters on the field, equal to the number of A-Counters this card had on the field.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – "A" Cell Incubator
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, an A-Counter will also be placed on "A" Cell Incubator if A-Counter(s) are removed as a cost.

name: F.A. Turbo Charger
oldText: Gains ATK equal to its Level x 300. Your opponent's monsters whose original Level/Rank is lower than this card's Level cannot target monsters for attacks, except this one. Your opponent cannot target monsters, except this one, with the effects of monsters whose original Level/Rank is lower than this card's Level. Each time a "F.A." Spell/Trap Card or effect is activated: You can increase this card's Level by 1. If your "F.A." monster battles while you control this Level 7 or higher card, your opponent's monsters cannot activate their effects until the end of the Damage Step.
newText: Gains ATK equal to its Level x 300. Your opponent's monsters whose original Level/Rank is lower than this card's Level cannot target monsters for attacks, except this one. Your opponent cannot target cards, except this one, with the effects of monsters whose original Level/Rank is lower than this card's Level. Each time a "F.A." Spell/Trap Card or effect is activated: You can increase this card's Level by 1. If your "F.A." monster battles while you control this Level 7 or higher card, your opponent's monsters cannot activate their effects until the end of the Damage Step.
author: gallantron

references.title: Q&A #22106
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of F.A. Turbo Charger also prevents Spells/Traps from being targeted by the effects of monsters with a lower original Level/Rank.

name: Cyber Angel Vrash
oldText: You can Ritual Summon this card with "Machine Angel Ritual". If this card is Ritual Summoned: You can destroy as many face-up monsters your opponent controls as possible that were Special Summoned from the Extra Deck, and if you do, inflict 1000 damage to your opponent for each, and if you do that, this card can make a second attack during each Battle Phase this turn. Once per turn, during either player's turn, when a card or effect is activated that would destroy a card on the field: You can shuffle 1 Ritual Monster from your Graveyard into the Deck; negate the activation, and if you do, destroy that card.
newText: You can Ritual Summon this card with "Machine Angel Ritual". If this card is Ritual Summoned: You can destroy as many monsters your opponent controls as possible that were Special Summoned from the Extra Deck, and if you do, inflict 1000 damage to your opponent for each, and if you do that, this card can make a second attack during each Battle Phase this turn. Once per turn, when a card or effect is activated that would destroy a card on the field (Quick Effect): You can shuffle 1 Ritual Monster from your GY into the Deck; negate the activation, and if you do, destroy that card.
author: gallantron

references.title: Cyber Angel Vrash
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Cyber Angel Vrash's effect will still destroy a monster that was Special Summoned from the Extra Deck in face-down Defense Position.

references.title: Toadally Awesome
references.desc: Toadally Awesome's effect responding to the activation of a Pendulum Monster Card's effect on the field is one example of how a card can be Special Summoned from the Extra Deck in face-down Defense Position.

references.title: Q&A #23330
references.desc:
If a monster is Special Summoned from the Extra Deck in face-down Defense Position, that monster is still considered to have been Special Summoned from the Extra Deck.
Only if a monster is flipped face-down after having been Special Summoned from the Extra Deck, that monster is no longer considered to have been Special Summoned from the Extra Deck.

name: Dai Dance
oldText: Choose 1 opponent's unused Main Monster Zone; if your opponent would Normal or Special Summon a monster to their Main Monster Zone, and the chosen zone can be used, they must use that zone. (They cannot Summon multiple monsters to their Main Monster Zones while this effect is applied.) This effect applies until the zone is occupied or becomes unusable. You can only apply the effect of "Dai Dance" once per Duel.
newText: Choose 1 opponent's unused Main Monster Zone; if your opponent would Normal or Special Summon a monster to a Main Monster Zone, and the chosen zone can be used, they must use that zone. (They cannot Summon multiple monsters to Main Monster Zones while this effect is applied.) This effect applies until the zone is occupied or becomes unusable. You can only apply the effect of "Dai Dance" once per Duel.
author: gallantron

references.title: Q&A #21477
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the opponent cannot Summon monsters to either player's Main Monster Zone, except the Zone chosen by Dai Dance.

name: Spiritual Beast Rampengu
oldText: Once per turn: You can banish 1 "Ritual Beast" monster from your Extra Deck and send 1 "Ritual Beast" monster with the same Type as that monster from your Deck to the Graveyard. You can only Special Summon "Spiritual Beast Rampengu(s)" once per turn.
newText: Once per turn: You can banish 1 "Ritual Beast" monster from your Extra Deck, and if you do, send 1 "Ritual Beast" monster with the same Type as that monster from your Deck to the GY. You can only Special Summon "Spiritual Beast Rampengu(s)" once per turn.
author: gallantron

references.title: Q&A #14319
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, even if the "Ritual Beast" monster from the Deck will not reach the GY, a "Ritual Beast" monster from the Extra Deck is still banished.

references.title: Nadir Servant
references.desc: Nadir Servant is another card with a comparable effect.

name: Marshmallon Glasses
oldText: While "Marshmallon" is in your Monster Zone, your opponent cannot target monsters other than "Marshmallon" for attacks.
newText: While "Marshmallon" is in your Monster Zone, monsters your opponent controls can only target "Marshmallon" for attacks.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Marshmallon Glasses
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Marshmallon Glasses also prevents monsters from selecting a player as an attack target.

name: Go! - D/D/D Divine Zero King Rage
oldText:
When this card declares an attack, if your opponent's LP is 4000 or less: You can make this card gain ATK equal to your opponent's LP, until the end of this turn. Cannot be destroyed by battle, also you take no damage from battles involving this card.
You can Tribute 1 other monster; apply 1 of these effects until the end of this turn.
●This card can attack directly.
●Your opponent cannot activate cards or effects in the Spell & Trap Zones.
●Your opponent cannot activate card effects in their hand or GY.
newText:
When this card declares an attack, if your opponent's LP is 4000 or less: You can make this card gain ATK equal to your opponent's LP, until the end of this turn. Cannot be destroyed by battle, also you take no damage from battles involving this card.
You can Tribute 1 other monster; apply 1 of these effects until the end of this turn.
●This card can attack directly.
●Your opponent cannot activate the effects of cards that are in a Spell & Trap Zone.
●Your opponent cannot activate the effects of cards that are in their hand or GY.
author: gallantron

references.title: Q&A #23478
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, after the effect of Go! - D/D/D Divine Zero King Rage that prevents effect activations of cards in the Spell & Trap Zone has resolved, cards can still be activated in the Spell & Trap Zone from the hand.

references.title: Q&A #21564
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, after the effect of Go! - D/D/D Divine Zero King Rage that prevents effect activations of cards in the hand or GY has resolved, cards in the hand cannot be activated, even if doing so would place them in the Spell & Trap Zone.

name: Transforming Sphere
oldText: Once per turn: You can target 1 face-up Defense Position monster your opponent controls; discard 1 card and equip that target to this card. (You can only equip 1 monster at a time to this card with this effect.) This card gains the ATK of the equipped monster. If this card attacks, it is changed to Defense Position at the end of the Battle Phase. During the End Phase: The monster equipped to this card by this card's effect is Special Summoned to your opponent's side of the field in face-up Defense Position.
newText: If this card attacks, it is changed to Defense Position at the end of the Battle Phase. Once per turn: You can target 1 face-up Defense Position monster your opponent controls; discard 1 card, and if you do, equip that opponent's monster to this card (max. 1). This card gains ATK equal to that equipped monster's. Once per turn, during the End Phase: Special Summon that equipped monster to your opponent's field in Defense Position.
author: gallantron

references.title: Q&A #9611
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the targeted monster is equipped to Transforming Sphere even if it is no longer face-up at resolution.

name: Evil Dragon Ananta
oldText: Cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. Must be Special Summoned by banishing all Reptile monsters you control and in your GY. This card's ATK/DEF become the number of monsters banished for its Special Summon x 600. Once per turn, during your End Phase: Target 1 card on the field; destroy that target.
newText: Cannot be Normal Summoned/Set. Must be Special Summoned by banishing all Reptile monsters you control and in your GY. This card's ATK/DEF become the number of monsters banished for its Special Summon x 600. Once per turn, during your End Phase: Target 1 card on the field; destroy it. This monster must be face-up on your field to activate and to resolve this effect.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Evil Dragon Ananta
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Evil Dragon Ananta must remain face-up on your field in order to destroy the targeted card.

name: Dinowrestler King T Wrextle
oldText:
2+ "Dinowrestler" monsters
If this card battles, your opponent cannot activate Spell/Trap Cards until the end of the Damage Step. Your opponent's monsters cannot target monsters for attacks, except this one. At the start of your opponent's Battle Phase: You can target 1 Attack Position monster your opponent controls; this Battle Phase, your opponent cannot attack with other monsters until that one has, and if it does not declare an attack, destroy it at the end of the Battle Phase.
newText:
2+ "Dinowrestler" monsters
If this card battles, your opponent cannot activate Spell/Trap Cards until the end of the Damage Step. Your opponent's monsters cannot target monsters for attacks, except this one. At the start of your opponent's Battle Phase: You can target 1 Attack Position monster your opponent controls; this Battle Phase, your opponent cannot declare attacks with other monsters until they have declared an attack with the targeted monster, also destroy it at the end of the Battle Phase if it did not declare an attack.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Dinowrestler King T Wrextle
