references.title: Q&A #22018
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, even if the targeted monster's attack is negated by Magic Cylinder, attacks can still be declared with other monsters.

name: Silent Magician LV4
oldText: Each time your opponent draws a card(s), place 1 Spell Counter on this card (max. 5). This card gains 500 ATK for each Spell Counter on it. During the Standby Phase of your next turn after the 5th Spell Counter is placed on this card: You can send this face-up card with 5 Spell Counters on it to the Graveyard; Special Summon 1 "Silent Magician LV8" from your hand or Deck.
newText: Each time your opponent draws a card(s), place 1 Spell Counter on this card (max. 5). This card gains 500 ATK for each Spell Counter on it. During the Standby Phase of your next turn after you place the 5th Spell Counter on this card: You can send this card with 5 Spell Counters to the GY; Special Summon 1 "Silent Magician LV8" from your hand or Deck.
author: gallantron

references.title: Q&A #13773
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of Silent Magician LV4 can only be activated by the player that placed the 5th Spell Counter on it.

name: Musakani Magatama
oldText: When your opponent activates a Spell/Trap Card, or monster effect, that destroys a card(s), while you control a "Six Samurai" monster: Negate the activation, and if you do, destroy it.
newText: When your opponent activates a Spell/Trap Card or monster effect that would destroys a card(s), and you control a "Six Samurai" monster: Negate the activation, and if you do, destroy it.
author: gallantron

references.title: Q&A #10603
references.desc:
In the Official Card Game, Musakani Magatama can be activated if a Spell/Trap Card or monster effect is activated that cannot currently resolve without attempting to destroy a card.
This is the behavior typically captured by the TCG qualifier "would". Contrast the qualifier "includes", which would allow Musakani Magatama to be activated in the scenario given.

name: Super Vehicroid - Stealth Union
oldText:
"Truckroid" + "Expressroid" + "Drillroid" + "Stealthroid"
Once per turn: You can target 1 face-up non-Machine monster on the field; equip that target to this card. While equipped with a monster by this effect, this card can attack all monsters your opponent controls, once each. If this card attacks, its original ATK is halved. If this card attacks a Defense Position monster, inflict piercing battle damage.
newText:
"Truckroid" + "Expressroid" + "Drillroid" + "Stealthroid"
Once per turn: You can target 1 face-up non-Machine monster on the field; equip that target to this card. While equipped with a monster by this effect, this card can attack all monsters your opponent controls, once each. If this card attacks, its original ATK is halved until the end of the Damage Step. If this card attacks a Defense Position monster, inflict piercing battle damage.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Super Vehicroid - Stealth Union
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of Super Vehicroid - Stealth Union that halves its ATK only applies for the duration of the Damage Step.

name: Fateful Adventure
oldText: Once per turn, the first time a monster you control equipped with an Equip Spell would be destroyed by battle, it is not destroyed. You can only use each of the following effects of "Fateful Adventure" once per turn. During your Main Phase: You can add 1 monster that mentions "Adventurer Token" from your Deck to your hand, then send 1 card from your hand to the GY. If a monster(s) is Normal or Special Summoned: You can take 1 Equip Spell that mentions "Adventurer Token" from your Deck, and either add it to your hand or equip it to 1 "Adventurer Token" you control.
newText: Once per turn, the first time a monster you control equipped with an Equip Card would be destroyed by battle, it is not destroyed. You can only use each of the following effects of "Fateful Adventure" once per turn. During your Main Phase: You can add 1 monster that mentions "Adventurer Token" from your Deck to your hand, then send 1 card from your hand to the GY. If a monster(s) is Normal or Special Summoned: You can take 1 Equip Spell that mentions "Adventurer Token" from your Deck, and either add it to your hand or equip it to 1 "Adventurer Token" you control.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Fateful Adventure
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of Fateful Adventure prevents a monster equipped with any Equip Card from being destroyed, even if that card is not an Equip Spell.

references.title: Kunai with Chain
references.desc: Kunai with Chain is one potential Equip Card that is not an Equip Spell.

name: Stall Turn
oldText: When a Spell/Trap Card, or monster effect, is activated that negates the Summon OR the activation of a Spell/Trap Card: Banish 3 cards from the top of your Deck, face-down; negate the activation, and if you do, shuffle that card into the Deck.
newText: When a Spell/Trap Card, or monster effect, is activated that would negate a Summon, or the activation of a Spell/Trap Card: Banish 3 cards from the top of your Deck, face-down; negate the activation, and if you do, shuffle that card into the Deck.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Stall Turn
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Stall Turn can be activated when a monster's Summon would be negated.

name: Exosister Kaspitell
oldText:

newText:
2 Level 4 monsters

2 Level 4 monsters

2 Level 4 monsters

name: Star Pendulumgraph
oldText: Your opponent cannot target Spellcaster-Type monsters you control with Spell Cards or effects. If a face-up "Magician" Pendulum Monster Card(s) leaves your Monster Zone or Pendulum Zone: Add 1 "Magician" Pendulum Monster from your Deck to your hand. You can only use this effect of "Star Pendulumgraph" once per turn.
newText: Your opponent cannot target Spellcaster monsters you control with Spell Cards or effects. If a face-up "Magician" Pendulum Monster Card(s) leaves the field from your Monster Zone or Pendulum Zone: Add 1 "Magician" Pendulum Monster from your Deck to your hand. references.title: Q&A #6540

references.title: Q&A #11549
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of Star Pendulumgraph will not activate if a face-up "Magician" Pendulum Monster Card leaves the Pendulum Zone, but does not leave the field.

name: Goddess Verdande's Guidance
oldText: When this card is activated: If all monsters you control are "Valkyrie" monsters (min. 1), you can add 1 "Goddess Urd's Verdict" from your Deck to your hand. Once per turn: You can declare 1 type of card (Monster, Spell, or Trap); reveal the top card of your opponent's Deck and if it was the declared type, they Set it to their field. Otherwise, they add it to their hand. You can only activate 1 "Goddess Verdande's Guidance" per turn.
newText: When this card is activated: If all monsters you control are "Valkyrie" monsters (min. 1), you can add 1 "Goddess Urd's Verdict" from your Deck to your hand. Once per turn: You can declare 1 type of card (Monster, Spell, or Trap); reveal the top card of your opponent's Deck and if it was the declared type, they Set it to their field. Otherwise, or if it cannot be Set, they add it to their hand. You can only activate 1 "Goddess Verdande's Guidance" per turn.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Goddess Verdande's Guidance
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, if the revealed card cannot be Set, it is still added to the opponent's hand.

references.title: Q&A #22628
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, if Link Apple cannot be Special Summoned during the resolution of its effect, the "Otherwise" part is not applied.

references.title: Q&A #8555
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, if Sunlight Unicorn's effect is unable to add the revealed card to the hand, the "Otherwise" part is not applied.

references.title: Q&A #17846
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, if The True Name is unable to add the revealed card to the hand, the "Otherwise" part is not applied.

name: Branded Disciple
oldText: When a monster effect activated by your opponent resolves, if that opponent's monster has 0 ATK or DEF, and you control a Level 8 or higher Fiend Fusion Monster, you can negate that activated effect. At the end of the Damage Step, if monsters with 0 ATK battled each other: You can destroy your opponent's battling monster. You can only use each effect of "Branded Disciple" once per turn.
newText: When a monster effect activated by your opponent resolves, if that opponent's monster has 0 ATK or DEF (its original ATK/DEF, if no longer face-up on the field), and you control a Level 8 or higher Fiend Fusion Monster, you can negate that activated effect. At the end of the Damage Step, if monsters with 0 ATK battled each other: You can destroy your opponent's battling monster. You can only use each effect of "Branded Disciple" once per turn.
author: gallantron

references.title: Q&A #23464
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, if the monster whose effect was activated is no longer face-up on the field by the time its effect resolves, the effect of Branded Disciple considers its original ATK/DEF.

name: Infernity Archfiend
oldText: When you draw this card, if you have no other cards in your hand: You can reveal this card; Special Summon this card from your hand. When this card is Special Summoned: You can add 1 "Infernity" card from your Deck to your hand. You must have no cards in your hand to activate and to resolve this effect.
newText: When you draw a card(s) while you have no cards in your hand, and you draw this card: You can reveal this card; Special Summon it from your hand. When this card is Special Summoned: You can add 1 "Infernity" card from your Deck to your hand. You must have no cards in your hand to activate and to resolve this effect.

references.title: Q&A #8720
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, if multiple cards (including Infernity Archfiend) are drawn at the same time, the effect of Infernity Archfiend can be activated as long as there were no cards in your hand before you drew.

oldText:
1 "Ritual Beast Ulti" monster + 1 "Ritual Beast Tamer" monster + 1 "Spiritual Beast" monster

name: Destructive Draw
oldText: If either player has no cards in their hand at the start of their Draw Phase, they can draw 1 more card in addition to their normal draw. This card's controller loses 700 Life Points during their End Phase. (If less than 700, they become 0 instead.) When this face-up card is removed from the field, inflict 3000 damage to the player who controlled it.

If the turn player draws card(s) for their normal draw while they have no cards in their hand: they can activate this effect; they draw 1 card. During the End Phase, you must pay 700 LP (this is not optional), otherwise your LP become 0.
If this face-up card leaves the field, you take 3000 damage.
author: gallantron

references.title: Card FAQ – Destructive Draw
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, Destructive Draw requires you to pay 700 LP, rather than having you lose 700 LP.

references.desc: In the Official Card Game, paying LP in the End Phase allows Masterking Archfiend's effect to be activated.

name: Fantastical Dragon Phantazmay
oldText: If your opponent Special Summons a Link Monster(s) (except during the Damage Step): You can Special Summon this card from your hand, draw cards equal to the number of Link Monsters your opponent controls +1, then shuffle cards from your hand into the Deck equal to the number of Link Monsters they control. When your opponent activates a card or effect that targets a monster(s) you control (Quick Effect): You can discard 1 card; negate the activation, and if you do, destroy it. You can only use each effect of "Fantastical Dragon Phantazmay" once per turn.
newText: If your opponent Special Summons a Link Monster(s) (except during the Damage Step): You can Special Summon this card from your hand, then draw cards equal to the number of Link Monsters your opponent controls +1, then shuffle cards from your hand into the Deck equal to the number of Link Monsters they control. name: Odd-Eyes Vortex Dragon

1 "Odd-Eyes" monster + 1 Pendulum Monster

During the End Phase, if this card is in your GY: You can target 1 LIGHT Warrior monster in your GY; shuffle it into the Deck, and if you do, add this card to your hand. You can only use each effect of "Joker's Straight" once per turn.
newText: Discard 1 card, and if you do, Special Summon 1 "Queen's Knight" from your Deck, and if you do that, add 1 "King's Knight" or "Jack's Knight" from your Deck to your hand, then, immediately after this effect resolves, you can Normal Summon 1 monster. name: Armory Arm
oldText:
1 Tuner + 1+ non-Tuner monsters
Once per turn, you can either: Target 1 monster on the field; equip this card to that target, OR: Unequip this card and Special Summon it in Attack Position. While equipped by this effect, that target gains 1000 ATK. If that target destroys a monster by battle and sends it to the GY: Inflict damage to your opponent equal to the destroyed monster's original ATK.
newText:
1 Tuner + 1+ non-Tuner monsters
Once per turn, you can either: Target 1 monster on the field; equip this card to that target, OR: Unequip this card and Special Summon it in Attack Position. While equipped by this effect, that target gains 1000 ATK. If that target destroys a monster by battle and sends it to the GY: Inflict damage to your opponent equal to the ATK of the destroyed monster in the GY.

references.title: Q&A #6259
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, if the destroyed monster is no longer in the GY by the time Armory Arm's effect resolves, no damage is inflicted.

references.title: Elemental HERO Shining Flare Wingman
references.desc: Elemental HERO Shining Flare Wingman, which was printed alongside Armory Arm in HAC1, uses "equal to that monster's original ATK in the GY."

references.title: Problem-Solving Card Text, Part 6: Finding Clues in TU6 & GENF

name: Tuningware
oldText: This card can be treated as a Level 2 monster when used for a Synchro Summon. If this card is sent to the Graveyard for a Synchro Summon: Draw 1 card.

references.title: Tuningware

name: Des Kangaroo

name: Venom Swamp

newText: During each player's End Phase: Place 1 Venom Counter on each face-up monster, except "Venom" monsters. Monsters lose 500 ATK for each Venom Counter on them. If a Venom Counter is placed on a monster(s), and its ATK becomes 0 as a result: Destroy the monster(s).

name: Guardian Dreadscythe

When this card is Special Summoned: You can equip 1 "Reaper Scythe - Dreadscythe" from your Deck to this card. You cannot Normal or Special Summon monsters (but you can Normal Set). references.title: Q&A #6112

(This card is always treated as an "Ultimate Crystal" card.)

name: Psi-Blocker
oldText: Once per turn: You can declare 1 card name; cards with that name, and their effects, cannot be used until the end of your opponent's next turn.
newText:
Once per turn: You can declare 1 card name; until the end of your opponent's next turn, apply these effects to all cards whose original name is the card name you declared.
●They cannot be placed on the field.
●They cannot be activated, nor can their effects be activated or applied.
●They cannot be Summoned or Set.
●They cannot attack, nor can they change their battle positions.
●They cannot be used as material for a Special Summon that requires materials.

name: Libromancer Firestarter

name: Number C105: Battlin' Boxer Comet Cestus
oldText:
4 Level 5 monsters

●Once per turn: You can detach 1 Xyz Material from this card, then target 1 monster your opponent controls; destroy it, and if you do, inflict damage to your opponent equal to the destroyed monster's ATK on the field.

name: Fifth Hope
oldText: Target 5 "Elemental HERO" cards in your Graveyard; shuffle them into the Deck, then draw 2 cards (draw 3 cards instead, if you had no other cards on your side of the field and in your hand when you activated this card).
newText: Target 5 "Elemental HERO" cards in your GY; shuffle all 5 into the Deck, then draw 2 cards. If you had no other cards on your side of the field and in your hand when you activated this card, draw 3 cards, instead.

references.title: Card FAQ – Fifth Hope
references.desc: In the Official Card Game, the effect of Fifth Hope needs to return all targeted cards to the Deck. If it cannot attempt to do so, the effect is not applied.

name: Agido the Ancient Sentinel

newText: If a card(s) is sent from the hand or Deck to your opponent's GY (except during the Damage Step): You can Special Summon this card from your hand, then you can Special Summon 1 Level 4 EARTH Fairy monster from your GY, except "Agido the Ancient Sentinel". name: Black Feather Whirlwind

newText: Once per turn, if you Special Summon a DARK Synchro Monster from the Extra Deck (except during the Damage Step): You can target 1 of your "Blackwing" monsters, or "Black-Winged Dragon", that is banished or in your GY, with less ATK than that Special Summoned monster; Special Summon it. name: The Winged Dragon of Ra - Sphere Mode
oldText: Cannot be Special Summoned. Requires 3 Tributes from either side of the field to Normal Summon to that side of the field (cannot be Normal Set), then shift control to this card's owner during the End Phase of the next turn. Cannot attack. Your opponent cannot target this card for attacks or by card effects. You can Tribute this card; Special Summon 1 "The Winged Dragon of Ra" from your hand or Deck, ignoring its Summoning conditions, and if you do, its ATK/DEF become 4000.
newText: Cannot be Special Summoned. Requires 3 Tributes from either side of the field to Normal Summon to that side of the field (cannot be Normal Set), then shift control to this card's owner during the End Phase of the next turn. Cannot attack. Your opponent cannot target this card with card effects, also monsters your opponent controls cannot target this card for attacks. references.title: Card FAQ – The Winged Dragon of Ra - Sphere Mode

In the Official Card Game, monsters that are unaffected by monster effects can target The Winged Dragon of Ra - Sphere Mode for attacks.
